title: 'By the time you're through security you're almost naked': Rikers Island – a cartoon
text:
The Illustrated City: as New York’s most famous jail is also one of its most secretive, artist Christopher Cardinale used his sketchbook to record his visits there

Christopher Cardinale is an artist and muralist in New York City whose work is inspired by social justice movements. He illustrated the graphic novel Mr Mendoza’s Paintbrush by Luis Alberto Urrea and the award-winning children’s book Which Side Are You On? The Story of a Song by George Ella Lyon. He is currently working on a graphic novel about Dorothy Day, a journalist and prominent human rights activist. His work can be found at christophercardinale.com and on Instagram @cardinale.graphics
